summary: This is an email chain between prosecutors and defense attorneys in the Ghislaine Maxwell case regarding stipulations to the authenticity of evidence, specifically three depositions (CA, DA, GM), a statement, and birth certificates. The correspondence shows legal negotiations ahead of trial proceedings.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: Defense attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell corresponding with prosecutors about stipulating to the authenticity of evidence including depositions.

persons.name: Jeff Pagliuca
persons.context: Defense attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell copied on email correspondence regarding trial evidence stipulations.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Defense attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell copied on email correspondence regarding trial evidence stipulations.

persons.name: Bobbi C Sternheim
persons.context: Defense attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell copied on email correspondence regarding trial evidence stipulations.

persons.name: Judge Nathan
persons.context: Presiding judge in the Ghislaine Maxwell case; prosecutors plan to raise the authentication issue with her.

persons.name: Lara E. Pomerantz
persons.context: Assistant United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York, corresponding with defense about evidence stipulations and trial preparations.

connections.description: Prosecutor and defense attorney negotiating evidence stipulations for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial.
Co-defense attorneys working together on the Ghislaine Maxwell case.
Co-defense attorneys working together on the Ghislaine Maxwell case.
Co-defense attorneys working together on the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

events.title: Email exchange on evidence stipulations
events.description: Prosecutors send corrected stipulation documents to defense regarding authenticity of three depositions (CA, DA, GM). Defense agrees to stipulate to depositions but needs more time for statement and birth certificates.

events.title: Defense agrees to stipulate to depositions
events.description: Christian Everdell emails prosecutors stating defense is prepared to stipulate to authenticity of three depositions (CA, DA, GM) but not yet to a statement or birth certificates.

events.title: Prosecutors send second set of proposed stipulations
events.description: Prosecutors send additional proposed stipulations to defense and request response before an upcoming conference.

events.title: Initial submission of verdict form and stipulations
events.description: Prosecutors send draft joint proposed request to charge, verdict sheet, and four proposed stipulations to defense counsel.

keyFacts: The defense agreed to stipulate to the authenticity of three depositions referenced as CA, DA, and GM.
The defense needed more time to consider stipulating to the authenticity of a statement and birth certificates.
Prosecutors planned to raise the authentication issue with Judge Nathan on Monday following this correspondence.
The email chain shows active trial preparation and evidence negotiation between prosecution and defense teams.
The correspondence references the need to prepare records custodians if stipulations weren't agreed upon.
